title: Saguaro National Park: Monthly Buffelgrass Pull
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer     Monthly Buffelgrass Pull              Monthly Buffelgrass Pull         NPS/Saguaro National Park  Help Preserve the Sonoran Desert by removing buffelgrass, a highly invasive grass that threatens native plants and wildlife populations. Volunteers are needed to assist with buffelgrass pulls, held the second Saturday of each month, from Sept-May. Work will be approximately 4 hours of digging up buffelgrass. We will meet at scheduled times (see schedule below) at the Rincon Mountain District Visitor Center. Bring a backpack with plenty of water. Pants, long sleeve shirt, and sturdy shoes are required. Tools and gloves will be provided. Looking forward to seeing you there! Please complete and bring with you the Volunteer Services Agreement Form. If you are under 18 years old, please have a parent or legal guardian complete their section. Scheduled buffelgrass pulls:     Saturday, September 12, 2015  7:00 am - 11:00 am    Saturday, October 10, 2015  7:00 am - 11:00 am    Saturday, November 14, 2015  8:00 am - 12:00 pm    Saturday, December 12, 2015  8:00 am - 12:00 pm    Saturday, January 9, 2016  8:00 am - 12:00 pm    Saturday, February 13, 2016  8:00 am - 12:00 pm    Saturday, March 12, 2016  8:00 am - 12:00 pm    Saturday, April 9, 2016  7:00 am - 11:00 am     Saturday, May 14, 2016  7:00 am - 11:00 am     Printable Flyer (PDF). For any questions contact us at (520) 733-5187 or email us.
